page.title: 02LYME REGIS COBB
page.content: The Cobb as you see it today plays a large part in Lyme Regis. It provides full time employment for the local fishermen all year round, and, supplies a safe Haven; not only for the local fishermen, but for any other fishermen around the area. The Cobb is a major attraction to the tourists. It's famous due to the visit by 'Jane Austen' and the filming of 'The French Lieutenants Women'. It has many other historic attractions too. The Cobb is also the towns main defence from the sea. If it were not for this barrier most of the town would have perished under the waves brought in by the strong South-Westerley winds.
